link.script:

div.style: background-size: cover; background-position: center center; background-image: url(https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/hYJbXUaemXlEEv4mPrnIH8-vlDZ4TRpKQ1Z7UFYHbaoiN1s5BJxReG_pWLdKHDyElqlel8OX=w16383);

div.p: According to a executive order from Governor Lamont, schools will not reopen until May 20 at the earliest.
Please visit our E-Learning website by clicking the button below:

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.em: We embrace the future with dedication and commitment, working in partnership with our community to ensure student achievement through excellence in teaching and learning in a safe and secure environment. Our goal is to educate, prepare and inspire all students to reach their full potential as lifelong learners, responsible thinkers, and productive contributors to our global society.

img.alt: Poetry Out Loud winners and participants

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

em.strong: Poetry Out Loud winners and participants

h3.div: Congrats to the Poetry Out Loud winners and participants

div.p: Congratulations to Gabriella Franchi, left, for winning the OHS Poetry Out Loud Competition on Jan. 23. Stephanie McNamara, center, was second, and Renee Barnes was third. Gabriella will next represent OHS at the state competition March 14 in Hartford.
